page.title: 12Saltram House and Surrounds
page.content: Saltram House is a Stately Home owned by the {National Trust. }It stands in a large area of land on the west of the area. Saltram House and Park are open to the public. People enjoy seeing the rooms and the gardens. The house is full of lovely furniture and pictures. Outside the house there are attractive gardens, grazing and woodlands. Stag Lodge stands by one of the gates leading into Saltram Park. It used to be the house of the gate keeper. Outside Saltram Park, but still inside the city boundary there is a large expanse of farmland. This consists in the main of rough grazing, but with arable crops and woodland. There are China Clay works and a stone quarry belonging to English China Clay.
